resources.string: We are collecting following data in order to manage you waste durring Covid-19 pandamic.
How to manage your waste during Covid-19?
Currently proper database server is not connected,so unable to generate the report.

Please find below covid-19 highlights, There are some non-hazardous wastes, like dry recyclable waste must also be handled with utmost care after coming in contact with covid-19 patients. The bigger challenge arises from the household and industrial waste of those exhibiting minor or negligible symptom as it affects the health of sanitation workers and informal sector waste collectors. As far as possible, dry waste should be quarantined within the premises for an appropriate time period before disposal, thereby allowing the virus to die. A virus stays on cardboard for about 24 hours and on plastics and stainless steel for about 72 hours, this creates a concern for sanitation workers and informal sector waste collectors.
Note: please ensure that your waste should be quarantined within the premises before generating your waste.
